name: Steve Wozniak
description: Co-founded Apple with Steve Jobs; engineered Apple I and II computers. Technical genius behind early personal computing revolution.

name: Paul Allen
description: Co-founded Microsoft with Bill Gates; funded research in AI, science, and space. Philanthropist and sports team owner.

name: Andy Grove
description: Led Intel through microprocessor revolution; author of "Only the Paranoid Survive." Transformed Intel into industry leader.

name: Larry Ellison
description: Founded Oracle Corporation, pioneered relational database software. Among world's wealthiest individuals, competitive sailor.

name: Reed Hastings
description: Co-founded Netflix, transforming from DVD rental to streaming giant that revolutionized entertainment industry and viewing habits globally.

name: Michael Bloomberg
description: Founded Bloomberg L.P., financial data empire. Served as New York City mayor, major philanthropist, and presidential candidate.

name: Warren Buffett
description: Legendary investor known as Oracle of Omaha. Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, one of world's wealthiest people, major philanthropist.

name: George Soros
description: Investor and philanthropist who "broke the Bank of England." Major donor to liberal and pro-democracy causes worldwide, controversial figure.

name: Pony Ma (馬化騰)
description: Founded Tencent, creator of WeChat and major gaming company. Among Asia's wealthiest, shaped China's internet landscape.

name: Masayoshi Son (孫正義)
description: Founded SoftBank, major investor in tech companies worldwide. Visionary but volatile investor, massive bets on AI and technology.

name: Deng Xiaoping (鄧小平)
description: Paramount leader who opened China to market reforms and foreign investment. "To get rich is glorious" - transformed China into economic powerhouse.

name: Lee Kuan Yew
description: Founding father of Singapore who transformed city-state from poverty to prosperity. Authoritarian but effective, model of developmental state.

name: Yitzhak Rabin
description: Israeli Prime Minister who signed Oslo Accords seeking peace with Palestinians. Assassinated by Jewish extremist, symbol of peace efforts.

name: Yasser Arafat
description: Leader of PLO and Palestinian Authority. Symbol of Palestinian nationalism, controversial figure between terrorist and freedom fighter.

name: Fidel Castro
description: Led Cuban Revolution, ruled Cuba for nearly 50 years. Communist leader who survived US attempts to overthrow him, polarizing legacy.

name: Hugo Chávez
description: Venezuelan president who pursued socialist policies and challenged US influence in Latin America. Charismatic but divisive, economic crisis followed.

name: Lech Wałęsa
description: Solidarity movement leader who helped end communism in Poland. Electrician turned president, Nobel Peace Prize winner, symbol of peaceful revolution.

name: Vaclav Havel
description: Playwright who became Czech president after Velvet Revolution. Intellectual leader of anti-communist movement, moral voice of post-Cold War Europe.

name: Shimon Peres
description: Israeli president and prime minister, key architect of Oslo peace process. Nobel Peace Prize winner, worked for Israeli-Palestinian reconciliation.

name: Kofi Annan
description: UN Secretary-General (1997-2006) who promoted human rights and peacekeeping. Nobel Peace Prize winner, elegant diplomat from Africa.

name: Muhammad Yunus
description: Founded Grameen Bank pioneering microfinance for poverty alleviation. Nobel Peace Prize winner, "banker to the poor."

name: Wangari Maathai
description: Environmental activist who founded Green Belt Movement planting millions of trees. First African woman to win Nobel Peace Prize.

name: Rigoberta Menchú
description: Indigenous rights activist who documented violence against Guatemala's Maya people. Nobel Peace Prize winner at age 33.

name: Shirin Ebadi
description: Iranian lawyer and human rights activist. First Muslim woman to win Nobel Peace Prize, advocate for democracy and women's rights.

name: Osama bin Laden
description: Founded al-Qaeda, orchestrated September 11 attacks killing nearly 3000 people. Killed by US forces in Pakistan, defining figure of terrorism and War on Terror.

name: Colin Powell
description: First Black US Secretary of State and Chairman of Joint Chiefs. Led Gulf War, career complicated by Iraq War WMD claims.

name: David Petraeus
description: US general who led Iraq surge and Afghanistan operations. Later CIA director, career ended in scandal but reshaped counterinsurgency doctrine.

name: Jane Goodall
description: Primatologist whose chimpanzee research revolutionized understanding of animal behavior and intelligence. Conservation advocate and UN Messenger of Peace.

name: E.O. Wilson
description: Biologist who pioneered sociobiology and championed biodiversity. "Darwin's natural heir," advocate for protecting half of Earth for nature.

name: James Watson
description: Co-discovered DNA double helix structure with Crick, revolutionizing biology. Nobel Prize winner, later controversial for comments on race and intelligence.

name: Rosalind Franklin
description: Chemist whose X-ray crystallography was crucial to discovering DNA structure. Contribution initially overlooked, posthumously recognized as key to discovery.

name: Carl Sagan
description: Astronomer who popularized science through Cosmos series and books. Advocated for critical thinking and searched for extraterrestrial life.

name: Shinya Yamanaka (山中伸弥)
description: Nobel Prize-winning stem cell researcher who discovered induced pluripotent stem cells. Revolutionary breakthrough avoiding embryonic stem cell controversies.

name: Maya Angelou
description: Poet and civil rights activist whose "I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings" became American classic. Powerful voice for Black women's experiences.

name: Salman Rushdie
description: Author whose "Satanic Verses" led to Iranian fatwa. Symbol of free speech versus religious censorship, survived 2022 assassination attempt.

name: J.K. Rowling
description: Created Harry Potter series, becoming world's best-selling book series. Billionaire author, later controversial for views on transgender issues.

name: Stephen King
description: Prolific horror and fiction writer with over 60 novels. "King of Horror" whose works adapted into countless films and TV series.

name: Isabel Allende
description: Latin America's most widely read author, known for magical realism. "The House of the Spirits" launched international career.

name: Mo Yan (莫言)
description: Nobel Prize-winning novelist known for vivid depictions of Chinese rural life. First Chinese citizen to win Nobel in Literature.

name: Princess Diana
description: Princess of Wales whose charisma and humanitarian work made her global icon. Tragic death in Paris car crash sparked unprecedented public mourning.

name: Robin Williams
description: Beloved comedian and actor known for manic energy and emotional depth. From "Mrs. Doubtfire" to "Good Will Hunting," tragic suicide shocked world.

name: Audrey Hepburn
description: Iconic actress and humanitarian. From "Breakfast at Tiffany's" to UNICEF ambassador, epitome of elegance and grace.

name: Stanley Kubrick
description: Perfectionist director who created "2001," "The Shining," "A Clockwork Orange." Influenced generations of filmmakers with visual mastery.

name: Akira Kurosawa (黒澤明)
description: Master filmmaker who influenced global cinema. "Seven Samurai," "Rashomon" established template for action films and psychological storytelling.

name: Martin Scorsese
description: Legendary director of "Taxi Driver," "Goodfellas," "The Departed." Champion of film preservation, defined modern American cinema.

name: Prince
description: Musical genius who blended funk, rock, pop, and R&B. "Purple Rain" iconic, known for flamboyant style and protecting artistic control.

name: Whitney Houston
description: One of best-selling music artists ever with powerful voice. "I Will Always Love You" iconic, tragic struggle with addiction.

name: Bob Marley
description: Reggae legend who brought genre to worldwide audience. Rastafarian icon, songs of peace and resistance remain timeless.

name: Freddie Mercury
description: Queen frontman with extraordinary vocal range and stage presence. "Bohemian Rhapsody" masterpiece, died of AIDS complications.

name: David Bowie
description: Shape-shifting artist who constantly reinvented himself. From Ziggy Stardust to Thin White Duke, influenced music, fashion, and culture.

name: Muhammad Ali
description: Greatest boxer who transcended sport as civil rights activist. "Float like butterfly, sting like bee," refused Vietnam draft, global icon.

name: Pelé
description: Football legend widely considered greatest player ever before Messi/Ronaldo era. Won three World Cups, scored over 1000 goals.

name: Diego Maradona
description: Football genius whose "Hand of God" and brilliant solo goal in 1986 World Cup epitomized his career. Flawed genius, beloved in Argentina.

name: Tiger Woods
description: Dominated golf like no one before, won 15 majors. Broke racial barriers, personal scandals affected legacy but comeback at 2019 Masters legendary.

name: Kobe Bryant
description: NBA legend with five championships and "Mamba Mentality." Tragic helicopter crash with daughter shocked world, massive global mourning.
